Our History
Staff Picks: Things to Do in Safety Harbor
Ellie
Aug 21
3 min read
Updated:
10 hours ago
Explore the hidden gems and favorite spots recommended by the Safety Harbor Art & Music Center team!
DON'T MISS THESE SPOTS:
WHIMZEYLAND - Image by
GinHol Photography
WhimzeyLand, "The Bowling Ball House"
1206 3rd St N, Safety Harbor, FL 34695
Created by SHAMc founders Todd Ramquist and Kiaralinda, WhimzeyLand is a one-of-a-kind art environment bursting with color, mosaics, sculptures, and hundreds of painted bowling balls. Visitors love it for its playful spirit, endless photo opportunities, and the way it captures the joy of creativity in everyday life.
Visit the WhimzeyLand Website
FOLLY FARM - Image via
I Love the Burg
Folly Farm Nature Preserve
1538 Dr. Martin Luther King Jr St N, Safety Harbor, FL 34695
A community green space with walking trails, butterfly gardens, and picnic areas. Folly Farms also has a moving feature called the
Wind Phone
, where visitors can share thoughts and memories with loved ones who’ve passed.
Visit the Folly Farm Website
WATERFRONT PARK - Image via
the City of Safety Harbor
Waterfront Park
110 Veterans Memorial Ln, Safety Harbor, FL 34695
Visit Waterfront Park for a gorgeous view of Tampa Bay. It’s a favorite for morning strolls, fishing, or simply soaking in the salty breeze and watching dolphins play. Please note that the pier was destroyed in a 2024 hurricane and is currently under construction.
WHERE TO EAT:
The Tides Market
305 Main St, Safety Harbor, FL 34695
We love this place! It's Michelin rated and oh-so delicious!
The Brinehouse
100 Main St Suite 104, Safety Harbor, FL 34695
Try the fries. We all agreed, they are the best.
Whistle Stop Grill And Bar
915 Main St, Safety Harbor, FL 34695
Perfect Florida fare in Florida-style outdoor seating.
The NONA Slice House
997 Main St, Safety Harbor, FL 34695
Best pizza joint in town!
Crooked Thumb Brewery
555 10th Ave S, Safety Harbor, FL 34695
A craft brewery and restaurant located in our little city!
THINGS TO DO:
Sit on the moon mosaic at Casa Loco (see below)
See how many
grapefruit artworks
you can spot around downtown Safety Harbor
MORE THINGS TO SEE:
Casa Loco
1205 3rd St N, Safety Harbor, FL 34695
Check out the exterior of Casa Loco, the airbnb owned by SHAMc Co-Founders Todd and Kiaralinda. Casa Loco is directly across from their art environment home, WhimzeyLand. Fun fact: The movie Chu and Blossom (2014) was filmed at Casa Loco.
Mosaics at Safety Harbor Library & City Hall
101 2nd St N, Safety Harbor, FL 34695 (Library)
750 Main St, Safety Harbor, FL 34695 (City Hall)
Both the library and city hall feature colorful mosaic art created with community involvement. These pieces highlight Safety Harbor’s creative spirit and showcase how public art brightens everyday spaces.
MORE OUTDOOR GEMS:
PHILIPPE PARK
2525 Philippe Pkwy, Safety Harbor, FL 34695
One of Pinellas County’s oldest and most beautiful parks, Philippe Park is famous for its shady oak trees, Native American mound, and sweeping waterfront views. It’s a perfect spot for picnics, history, and relaxation under the canopy.
Visit the Philippe Park Website
MANGROVE WALK
110 Veterans Memorial Ln, Safety Harbor, FL 34695
A tranquil boardwalk winding through mangrove forests along the shoreline. Visitors love the peaceful views of the bay, birdwatching opportunities, and the feeling of being surrounded by nature just steps from downtown.
BARANOFF OAK (AT BARANOFF PARK)
326 4th Ave N, Safety Harbor, FL 34695
The Baranoff Oak is a massive live oak estimated to be over 300–500 years old. People love to stand beneath its sprawling branches, feeling connected to centuries of history and the deep roots of Safety Harbor.
MULLET CREEK PARK
536 Philippe Pkwy, Safety Harbor, FL 34695
This hidden neighborhood park has a playground, basketball court, and peaceful creekside setting. Families love it as a quiet place to relax while kids play under shady trees.
SAFETY HARBOR SKATE PARK
650 9th Ave S, Safety Harbor, FL 34695
A hotspot for local skaters and bikers with ramps, bowls, and rails. It’s a great place to see local talent in action or just enjoy the lively energy of the skate community.
MOCCASIN LAKE NATURE PARK
2750 Park Trail Ln, Clearwater, FL 33759
Just minutes from Safety Harbor, this 51-acre nature preserve is home to wildlife exhibits, nature trails, and rehabilitated birds of prey. Visitors love it as a peaceful retreat to connect with Florida’s native habitats.
BONUS:
This video by MikelParis (of O.A.R.) was made at SHAMc!

Located in the Greater Tampa Bay Area of Florida, our mission is to promote knowledge of and education in the fine arts, the visual arts, and the performing arts. We’re powered by volunteers and deeply grateful to everyone who has contributed to SHAMc!
© 2025 Safety Harbor Art and Music Center. All rights reserved.
We are a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization; EIN: 45-1473112
Website designed and developed by
Katie Bush

ABOUT SAFETY HARBOR ART & MUSIC CENTER
Once upon a time, there lived two artists named Todd and Kiaralinda. They spent their lives turning their home into a work of art. They shared a magical dream of creating a place where creativity and community could blossom together.
With the help of their friend, Heather Richardson, a Pepsi Refresh Grant, a team of hardworking volunteers/artists/creatives, and unwavering community support, they were able to see their dream come to life.
Our building was designed by Grant Genova and Dan Carlson. The Safety Harbor Art and Music Center (SHAMc) opened its doors in 2015 and instantly became a unique and vibrant cultural haven for art and music lovers alike. Over 290 people volunteered to help create mirror mosaics that permanently adorn the exterior of the building. SHAMc is a place where children and the children-at-heart can gather to celebrate art.
SHAMc is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization; EIN: 45-1473112. All donations to SHAMc are tax deductible.

FREQUENTLY ASKED
Questions
Where is SHAMc located?
Safety Harbor Art and Music Center (SHAMc for short) is located at 706 2nd Street North in Safety Harbor, FL 34695. Safety Harbor, Florida, is a city on the west shore of Tampa Bay in Pinellas County. We're a convenient short walking distance from downtown Safety Harbor and it's main street. We're the colorful building with the giant pink elephant out in front.
What are SHAMc's hours?
Our current hours of operation for the 2024/25 season (September 19, 2024 through June 30, 2025) are Thursday and Friday from Noon to 5 pm and Saturday and Sunday from 10 am to 5 pm.
Can I bring my dog, cat, or chicken to SHAMc?
Sorry, no pets are allowed. Only approved service animals are permitted inside of the venue.
Is there parking at SHAMc?
We have limited spaces in front of SHAMc. Street parking is available except where the curbs are painted yellow. There are some city lots nearby. Do not park in the Gigglewaters parking lot adjacent to Daydreamers Cafe as you may be towed. We have one parking space for individuals who are handicapped directly in front of our building.
Is SHAMc wheelchair accessible?
The SHAMc building is ADA compliant. If you are touring the SHAMc Complex, Whimzey Land and Casa Loco are offsite and have grass and mulch paths. Please contact us using the form on this page with any other questions about accessibility and we would be happy to assist.
Can I bring my own drinks to SHAMc?
No, outside beverages are not allowed. We are a licensed venue, and bringing your own drinks could put our liquor license at risk. We appreciate your understanding and support in helping us stay compliant with local regulations. Enjoy our great selection at the bar instead!
I have a large group, can I schedule a tour?
Absolutely! We love large groups. You can submit the form on this page to book a tour or visit the tour page on our website.
Is there a charge for children on tours?
Children 4 and under are free on our tours.
Can I add on an art project to my tour?
Yes! Please add this request when contacting us about a tour of the SHAMc Complex.
An event was sold out/I was waitlisted for a concert. What are my options?
When a concert reaches capacity and sells out, a waitlist is enabled. If a spot opens, waitlisted individuals are notified in the order they joined.
We call people on the phone directly to offer these spots.
More than likely, if you are contacted, it will be on the day of the concert. It has also come to our attention that there is a resale market and that many of these are scams. If you're purchasing resale, do so at your own risk. We recommend that you register for the event as early as possible to avoid being waitlisted. You can learn about our upcoming concerts from our weekly email - Sign up below!
Can I/my band play at SHAMc?
Todd Ramquist is in charge of booking music events, and he works directly with booking agent and managers. We are a small mom-and-pop venue, but we try to bring top tier musicians and artists to our space, most of them award-winning and with a strong following. If you meet this criteria, please have your booking agent
reach out to Todd directly
. If you're a local musician looking to get your foot in the door, we recommend coming to our
Open Mic Nights
.
Are supplies included in the workshop I'm taking?
Yes, all supplies are included unless otherwise communicated in the class description or via email.
I was waitlisted for a class. What does that mean?
When a class reaches capacity, a waitlist is enabled. If a spot opens, waitlisted individuals are notified in the order they joined. You have 24 hours to register before the next person is contacted.
Can I donate art supplies to SHAMc?
Yes, please
email us
a photo and description of the supplies you want to donate. Due to limited space, we cannot accept everything. You can view a list of needed items
here
. SHAMc is a non-profit organization and, as such, all donations are tax deductible.
Are phones allowed at Summer Camps?
Yes. We believe that phones are a part of the artistic journey. As such, we allow phones at our summer camps as long as participants use them for creative purpose. Examples of this are photography or making videos.
Can I teach a workshop at SHAMc?
We are always looking for new, creative ideas to expand our offerings. To be considered, please
fill out this form
with your workshop idea, description, and sample images and our Director will be in touch.
SHAMc BOARD OF DIRECTORS
Bobbie Dusenberry
CFO, Sahlman Seafoods
Montiki
Creative Director, Digital Media Solutions
Pedro Jarquin
Teacher, Enterprise High School
MAKE OUR ART BEAT!
To all our amazing SHAMc volunteers: We wouldn't be where we are today without the countless hours and unwavering dedication from each of you. Your creativity, passion, and hard work are the driving force behind everything we do. Thank you for being the heartbeat of our community and for helping us bring our vision to life!
Want to get involved? Fill out the form!

Located in the Greater Tampa Bay Area of Florida, our mission is to promote knowledge of and education in the fine arts, the visual arts, and the performing arts. We’re powered by volunteers and deeply grateful to everyone who has contributed to SHAMc!
© 2025 Safety Harbor Art and Music Center. All rights reserved.
We are a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization; EIN: 45-1473112
